content:
AllTrails is an excellent resource for finding and exploring hiking trails.

Yes, AllTrails does have a feature to filter trails by difficulty level. In fact, they offer a range of filters to help you find the perfect trail for your needs. Here's how you can filter trails by difficulty level on AllTrails:

1. **Web Version**: On the AllTrails website, you can filter trails by difficulty level by using the "Filter" button on the top-right corner of the trail list page. Click on "Filter" and then select "Difficulty" from the dropdown menu. You can choose from the following difficulty levels:
	* Easy
	* Easy to Moderate
	* Moderate
	* Moderate to Difficult
	* Difficult
2. **Mobile App**: On the AllTrails mobile app, you can filter trails by difficulty level by tapping on the "Filters" icon (looks like a funnel) on the top-right corner of the trail list screen. Then, tap on "Difficulty" and select your preferred level from the same options as above.

Additionally, you can also filter trails by other criteria, such as:

* Distance
* Elevation gain
* Rating (based on user reviews)
* Features (e.g., waterfalls, scenic views, lakes, etc.)
* Trail type (e.g., out and back, loop, point to point, etc.)
* Accessibility (e.g., wheelchair accessible, dog-friendly, etc.)

By using these filters, you can narrow down your search to find trails that suit your fitness level, interests, and preferences. Happy trail hunting!
